overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to forecasting 96-hour oil temperature data, starting with data inspection and method evaluation before settling on a simple averaging technique. The analysis acknowledges data limitations (only 4 days of history) and handles observed anomalies, ultimately implementing an hourly average method with precision considerations.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in provided data
Temperature fluctuations (drops at night, rises during day)
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) restricts complex model application (e.g., SARIMA)
Anomaly handling through averaging mitigates impact of outlier days
Hourly grouping preserves daily seasonal patterns
Precision maintenance (6 decimal places) to match input data format
Repetition of averaged daily pattern for multi-day forecasts
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Initial consideration of advanced models (SARIMA/ETS) followed by detailed heuristic implementation with anomaly adjustments and precision management.
